RectMatrixPtr Molecule::getPermutationMatrix ( boost::intrusive_ptr< SymmetryOperation >  oper  ) 

Gets the permutation matrix associated with a given symmetry operation. Suppose we have methane with the numbering C1,H2,H3,H4,H5. If we have a C3 operation that maps 2->3, 3->4, 4->2. If the operation permutes (i->j) then in the permutation matrix. Otherwise, the matrix element is zero. For the symmetry operation given above, the matrix is

Parameters:
oper The symmetry operation
Exceptions:
If the symmetry operation is not valid for the molecule

void Molecule::resetAtomXYZ (  )  [private]

Sets the xyz coordinates of the atoms after an update of the molecule xyz coordinates. This must happen currently because the molecule and atom xyz coordinates are stored in two different locations. This needs to change

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<SymmetryOperation> > gigide::Molecule::SYMM_OPS [static, private]

std::map<std::string, RectMatrixPtr> gigide::Molecule::symm_permute_ [private]

For each symmetry operation of the molecule, this keeps track of what permuation the operation corresponds to, i.e. for water numbers as O1,H2,H3 the C2 operation would have a permutation represenation (23)

double gigide::Molecule::symm_tolerance_ [private]

The tolerance for declaring two atoms as equivalent after a symmetry operation

RectMatrixPtr gigide::Molecule::xyz_ [private]

The xyz coordinates. This will be in in whatever units are specified by the bond units keyword.
